What are the quadratic residues of the prime number 7?

Hint: To find the quadratic residues of a prime number, you need to evaluate the squares of all the numbers from 0 to (p-1)/2, where p is the prime number.
message_2:
To find the quadratic residues of the prime number 7, we need to evaluate the squares of all the numbers from 0 to (p-1)/2, where p is the prime number. In this case, p = 7.

So, we need to evaluate the squares of all the numbers from 0 to (7-1)/2 = 3.

0² ≡ 0 (mod 7)
1² ≡ 1 (mod 7)
2² ≡ 4 (mod 7)
3² ≡ 9 ≡ 2 (mod 7)

The quadratic residues of the prime number 7 are {0, 1, 2, 4}.
